snippet.title: PNG economic outlook report reveals massive budget mismanagement
snippet.content: The new PNG government will be greeted by the Midyear Economic and Fiscal Outlook from the treasury and it's doesn't make good reading. It's already been described in some quarters as an extraordinary document, and a damning insight into Prime Minister Peter O'Neill's budget mismanagement, revealing as it does a deficit that is one billion kina larger than the forecast released just 7 months ago. A former PNG treasury advisor and director of the think-tank Indo-Pacific Public Policy and Economics, Paul Flanagan, says the next government has a big job on its hands to turn things around.
